title: A Sleeping Star Wakes Up and Shines Bright
summary: Scientists watched a special star called a neutron star wake up and become very bright. This star is in a galaxy far away, about 10 million light-years from Earth. When gas falls onto the star because of its strong gravity, it makes X-rays, which are a type of light we can't see with our eyes. The star was sleeping and not very bright for a while, but then it started to shine again in 2022 and got much brighter by 2024. The star spins very fast, and scientists found that when it got brighter, it also spun faster. This helps them understand how gas falls onto stars and makes them light up. They used telescopes in space to watch this happen over many years.

background_read: Neutron stars are the leftover cores of big stars that exploded. They are very small but super heavy, with strong gravity that can pull in gas from space. When gas falls onto them, it heats up and glows, making X-rays that scientists study to learn about stars and space.
Article_Structure: WHO: Scientists from Ehime University and other researchers
WHAT: Watched a neutron star wake up and become very bright by emitting X-rays
WHERE: In the galaxy NGC 7793, about 10 million light-years from Earth
WHY: To understand how gas falls onto stars and makes them shine

perspectives.description: This observation helps scientists learn more about how neutron stars behave and change over time.
